posts.content:
Earlier this year a van owners worst nightmare happened and the engine caught fire. Thankfully the fire brigade were very quick and after some haggling with the insurers I got the van back and it's well on the way to recovery.
Following the fire the existing original headlining was stripped out and i now need some good pictures showing this, so that the very good headlining man i knows how to replace it.

The van is 1961 with a Devon interior if that makes any difference. Any good picture particularly the front bit around the vent would be much appreciated.

Kevin

I'd be interested in seeing some headlining pic's of all those areas too

who's up for posting some pic's to help this poor guy out and at the same time helping me see what I have to look forward to when i do my headlining

Mark

author.location: Off the shoulder of Orion, watching C-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhauser Gate

posts.content:
1962 Devonette Original union cloth silver beige headlining...50 yeasr of dirt and water and rust stained









Seven headlining bows front to back - headlining tucked into grippers over doors and around fresh air box... cards over windsreen covered as well... trim down side panels around windows.
Carefully removed and sold to a patina bus owner...

Cheers. These are just the short of pictures I need. Van now resprayed with new reconned engine and gearbox. Now off to headliners!!
Hopefully back on the road by Easter ready for a few camping weekends away.
Cheers again for help.!! Kevin
